alert.note: Alert for Gogebic; Ontonagon (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 9:37PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: .Widespread flooding is currently ongoing across the western half of Gogebic County. Multiple roads have been reported closed or covered in water. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CDT/4 PM EDT/ THURSDAY... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by snowmelt is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of western Upper Michigan, including the following counties, Gogebic and Ontonagon. * WHEN...Until 300 PM CDT Thursday /400 PM EDT Thursday/. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Roads are closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 835 PM CDT /935 PM EDT/, emergency management reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ironwood, Porcupine Mountains State Park, Bessemer, Wakefield, Thomaston, Copper Peak, Ironwood Airport, Black River Harbor, Chaney Lake and Little Girls Point. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
